H0.text: A dog sitting on command is an example of inherited behavior.

H1.text: A parrot repeating a phrase is an example of inherited behavior.

H2.text: A bird flying south for the winter is an example of inherited behavior, where the migration pattern is genetically encoded rather than learned.

H3.text: A horse competing in a horse show is an example of inherited behavior.

A4.text: for example, a dog can improve its listening skills by practice.

A5.text: The control of migration, its timing and response are genetically controlled and appear to be a primitive trait that is present even in non-migratory species of birds.

A6.text: It has been possible to teach a migration route to a flock of birds, for example in reâ€‘introduction schemes.

A7.text: nearly all researched behaviours are under a significant degree of genetic influence

A8.text: All behavioural traits and disorders are influenced by genes
